benchmark_details.name: InfoDet: A Dataset for Infographic Element Detection
benchmark_details.overview: InfoDet is a dataset designed to support the development of accurate object detection models for charts and human-recognizable objects (HROs) in infographics. It contains 11,264 real and 90,000 synthetic infographics, with over 14 million bounding box annotations.
benchmark_details.data_type: infographic images with bounding box annotations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to enhance the chart understanding capabilities of vision-language models and support object detection models for infographic elements.

data.source: Real infographics collected from chart-rich online platforms and synthetic infographics created programmatically from design templates.
data.annotation: Bounding box annotations created through a combination of model-in-the-loop and programmatic methods.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the true positive, false positive, and false negative detections from the object detection models evaluated on the InfoDet test set.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mAP and AR indicate better performance in accurately detecting infographic elements.
methodology.baseline_results: The best-performing models achieve an mAP of up to 88.2% for chart and HRO categories.
